newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Indonesia minister says too early to accuse Bre-X.
newsitem.headline: Indonesia minister says too early to accuse Bre-X.

text.p: Indonesia's Mines and Energy Minister Ida Bagus Sudjana said his ministry was not in a position to judge Canada's Bre-X Minerals Ltd on the amount of gold at the Busang property, the official Antara news agency reported on Tuesday.
"There is no tendency to say that it (Bre-X) has lied... we can't make such a judgement," the official Antara news agency quoted him as saying in the East Kalimantan capital Samarinda.

Bre-X said last Wednesday the Busang property in East Kalimantan province might hold less than the 71 million ounces of gold it had earlier declared. The original amount would make it the gold find of the century.

"There appears to be a strong possibility that the potential gold resources on the Busang property... have been overstated because of invalid samples and assaying of those samples," Bre-X chief executive David Walsh said in a statement.
Sudjana told reporters the government was waiting for the results of study being carried out by a team which included local government officials, Bre-X and Freeport-McMoRan Copper and Gold Inc.
Freeport has a 15-percent stake in the Busang property, Bre-X 45 percent and Indonesian interests the rest.
